bibl.title: The Transmission of the New Testament and its Reliability.
bibl.note: Reproduit de: Proceedings of the 945th Ordinary General Meeting of the Victoria Institute on 15 April, 1957 (Croydon, 1957) pp. 92-101 = The Bible Translator 9 (1958) pp. 127-136. - The early witnesses for the New Testament (three Chester Beatty Papyri, the Bodmer Papyrus containing John 1:1-6 etc.) reveal that the variation in text between manuscript and manuscript existed already by A.D. 200.

bibl.title: G.D. KILPATRICK, The Principles and Practice of New Testament Textual Criticism. Collected Essays

bibl.seg: KILPATRICK G.D., The Transmission of the New Testament and its Reliability.
G.D. KILPATRICK, The Principles and Practice of New Testament Textual Criticism. Collected Essays (Leuven, 1990) pp. 3-14.

Reproduit de: Proceedings of the 945th Ordinary General Meeting of the Victoria Institute on 15 April, 1957 (Croydon, 1957) pp. 92-101 = The Bible Translator 9 (1958) pp. 127-136. - The early witnesses for the New Testament (three Chester Beatty Papyri, the Bodmer Papyrus containing John 1:1-6 etc.) reveal that the variation in text between manuscript and manuscript existed already by A.D. 200.
